alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Lowndes; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 3:40PM EDT until June 15 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Brooks County in south central Georgia... Lowndes County in south central Georgia... Thomas County in south central Georgia... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 340 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. Several roads are flooded in Thomas, Brooks, and Lowndes counties. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Quitman, Valdosta, Thomasville, Lake Park, Hahira, Boston, Ochlocknee, Pavo, Coolidge, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Dasher, Morven, Barwick, Brooks Co A/p, Dixie, Pidcock, Blue Springs and Oaklawn. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
